isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - INSTALL - Install REAR WINDOW GLASS AND WEATHER SEAL (EXCEPT SLEEPER MODELS)

svcproc.title: Install REAR WINDOW GLASS AND WEATHER SEAL (EXCEPT SLEEPER MODELS)
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 155 for Items in parentheses.

A one-piece weather seal (Item 1) secures rear window glass (Item 2) to cab. Weather seal is molded to fit tightly over the window fence flange at edge of window opening so it secures glass in window opening.

note.para: Because old weather seals are likely to be damaged, always install a new seal when replacing glass.
Use only heat treated glass (AS-2 per ANSI Z26.1-Latest revision).

step1.para: Clean remaining window seal from rear window fence. Apply soapy solution to window fence and channels of weather seal (Item 1) to ease installation. Locate vulcanized joint at top center of rear window opening, then install new weather seal around perimeter.
Install rear window glass (Item 2) from outside cab. Start glass into channels on driver's side (left) and push glass to the right (Item 3).

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. SLIDE WINDOW IN DIRECTION OF ARROW (FOR INSTALLATION)

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 156 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Use a weather seal tool (Item 2) to seat edge of weather seal (Item 1) over the right side of glass. Then install left end of glass.
Insert weather seal tool (Item 2) into seal so it catches inner seal, then pull weather seal tool all the way around seal in direction of arrow (Item 3) to fully seat seal lip.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. PULL TOOL IN DIRECTION OF ARROW

svcproc.para:
Refer to
SPECIAL SERVICE TOOLS
for correct tool to install rear window glass.

note.para: Do not over seal the lips (Figure 157) and (Figure 158) . If the lips are over sealed, run the weather seal tool over area again.
